document.docTitle: Physatocheila consueta Souma & Ishikawa 2022, comb. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic review of the tingine genera Cysteochila, Hurdchila, Physatocheila, and Xynotingis from Japan, with description of a new genus (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Tingidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic review of the tingine genera Cysteochila, Hurdchila, Physatocheila, and Xynotingis from Japan, with description of a new genus (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Tingidae)

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Entomological Laboratory, Graduate School of Bioresource and Bioenvironmental Sciences, Kyushu University, Fukuoka, Japan. kodokusignal @ gmail. com; https: // orcid. org / 0000 - 0002 - 2238 - 5015 & Research Fellowship for Young Scientists (DC 1), Japan Society for the Promotion of Science, Tokyo, Japan
Laboratory of Entomology, Faculty of Agriculture, Tokyo University of Agriculture, Kanagawa, Japan.

. Holotype : macropterous ♂ , Taiwan ; USNM.

TAIWAN :
Bunzan-gun , Mt. Rara ,
19–20.vi.1938
, leg. S. Nomura ( 1 ♂ , ELKU )
;
Taich-sh , Kahodai-Reimei , Hassenzan ,
12.vii.1932
, leg. T. Esaki ( 1 ♀ , ELKU )
;
Nantou County , Ren'ai Township , Tattaka , Lixing Industry Road , 2404'25.4" N 12109 '32.2"E,
19.v.2016
, leg. Y. Tamadera ( 1 ♂ 1 ♀ , NMNS )
. Two specimens deposited in ELKU are labeled “
Cysteochila esakii Takeya, 1962
” (manuscript name). A single nymph is in a poor condition and, therefore, not described in the present article.

Diagnosis. Recognized among other species of
Physatocheila
by a combination of the following characters: general color light brown ( Figs. 8B , 9B , 10B , 11B ); median spine on head extending beyond bases of frontal spines; rostrum reaching posterior margin of mesosternum; pubescence on pronotum less than 0.5 times as long as diameter of compound eye; lateral carinae of pronotum close to each other in anterior part, concealed by paranotum in anterior part; paranota incompletely covering pronotal disc in anterior part, not touching each other, not concealing median carina of pronotum, widened posteriorly, bulged upward in posterior part, forming a cyst; cyst of paranotum not concave in posterior part; outer margin of paranotum gently curved outward in its entire length; costal area of hemelytron wider than subcostal area at widest part, less than 0.5 times as wide as discoidal area at widest part, with a single row of areolae in apical part and 2 rows in remaining parts; and subcostal area subhorizontal, with 2 rows of areolae in its entire length.

Remarks. This species belongs to
Physatocheila
based on the presence of generic characteristics, as mentioned in the Diagnosis section. Therefore, the new combination,
Physatocheila consueta (Drake, 1948)
comb. nov.
, is proposed.

These specimens matched the photographs of the holotype (http://twinsecttype.nmns.edu.tw/specimen/?id=NMNS-USNM-00042; http://n 2t .net/ark:/65665/30e912f6b-9ac6-4a4c-8f15-67eddf9f871e) and the original description (Drake 1948) of
P . consueta
comb. nov.
described from Taiwan in general appearance.

Physatocheila consueta
comb. nov.
resembles
P . chiniana
comb. nov.
in general appearance but can be distinguished from it by the following characteristics: paranotum incompletely covering pronotal disc in anterior part, not touching median carina of pronotum ( Fig. 8B ); costal area of hemelytron with a single row of areolae in apical part and in 2 rows in remaining parts; subcostal area of hemelytron subhorizontal: metasternum wider than mesosternum ( Fig. 9B ); and metasternal laminae curved outward.
Distribution. Japan (Ryukyu Islands: Ishigaki Island), Korea ?, Taiwan , Vietnam .

As mentioned in the section on
P. chiniana
comb. nov.
, previous records of
P. consueta
comb nov.
from Japan are all doubtful. Therefore, reliable records of the “true”
P. consueta
comb. nov.
from Japan are presented here for the first time. The photograph of
C . consueta
from Korea provided by
Cho et al . (2020)
represents
P. chiniana
comb. nov.
, therefore the occurrence of
P. consueta
comb. nov.
in Korea is in need of confirmation. Discovery of
P . consueta
comb nov.
from Ishigaki Island represents the northernmost reliable distributional record for this species.

Host plant. The first author of the present study confirmed
Ampelopsis glandulosa (Wall.) Momiy. var. hancei (Planch.) Momiy.
( Vitaceae ) ( Fig. 13C ) as the host plant for
P. consueta
comb. nov.

Biology. A number of individuals of
Physatocheila consueta
comb. nov.
were collected from the leaves of the host plant
Ampelopsis glandulosa var. hancei
in the Ryukyu Islands, suggesting that this species is folivorous, similar to many tingids ( Schuh & Weirauch 2020 ).
In Japan , adults were observed from April to June and in November, and nymphs were observed in November (present study). Conversely, adults were collected from May to July in Taiwan (present study).
